items.title: Hatenboer krijgt rood bij Eredivisie-debuut, Regeer valt uit
items.summary: Cedric Hatenboer kende zondag een uiterst ongelukkig Eredivisie-debuut voor Telstar. De voormalig middenvelder van Excelsior, op huurbasis overgekomen van Anderlecht, kreeg in zijn eerste wedstrijd een rode kaart voor een tackle van achteren op Youri Regeer. De middenvelder van Ajax moest de strijd uiteindelijk staken.

items.title: Bijzondere split bij Sparta: veel tegengoals, clean sheet-koploper
items.summary: Sparta Rotterdam incasseerde dit Eredivisie-seizoen 31 treffers en houdt daarmee slechts vier andere teams onder zich, maar bijzonder genoeg is de club van trainer Maurice Steijn wel de clean sheet-koning van de Eredivisie.

items.title: Why McLaren are more confident than rivals ahead of 2026 F1 season
items.summary: Despite a total reset of Formula 1's regulations ahead of the 2026 season, reigning champions McLaren appear to be entering the sport's new era with more confidence than their expected main rivals.

items.title: Captain Frenkie de Jong laat zich zien: 'Zijn beste wedstrijd voor Barcelona'
items.summary: Frenkie de Jong kreeg rood in de finale van de Spaanse Supercup tegen Real Madrid, maar ontving toch lovende kritieken in de Spaanse pers. De rode kaart veranderde daar niets aan.

items.summary: Michael Carrick has growing support within Manchester United for the role of interim manager, with sources telling ESPN that the former midfielder has significant backing.

items.title: Raphinha's 'intensity' leads Bar√ßa Supercopa win
items.summary: Barcelona manager Hansi Flick lauded Raphinha's mentality after the Brazilian haunted Real Madrid once again with two goals in his team's 3-2 Spanish Supercopa final win in Saudi Arabia on Sunday.

items.summary: Manchester United released a statement announcing that captain Bruno Fernandes' social media platform X account was hacked.

items.title: Martinelli hat-trick as Arsenal beat Portsmouth
items.summary: Gabriel Martinelli scored a hat-trick as Arsenal overcame an early scare to thrash Championship strugglers Portsmouth 4-1 in the FA Cup third round.

items.title: Football transfer rumours: Liverpool and Chelsea eye Ram√≥n? Gallagher to Spurs?
items.summary: Today‚Äôs rumours need a bit of a stir Most footballers become famous for playing the game but others attract renown for not liking it ‚Äì foremost among the latter category is Arsenal‚Äôs Ben White. Accordingly, it would make sense were he to join David Moyes‚Äôs Everton, who are seeking to resolve a problematic right-back situation. The chance to follow in the footsteps of Tony Hibbert, typically a huge pull factor, is nullified because White presumably has no idea who he is. Elsewhere on Merseyside, it appears Liverpool have finally discovered the best way to improve a dodgy defence is not to buss hundreds of millions on attackers, but to have decent defenders. Consequently, they are looking at Como‚Äôs Jacobo Ram√≥n ‚Äì and so too are Chelsea, should the romance of being stockpiled with a 68-year contract prove too alluring to turn down. Continue reading...

items.title: Qatar in talks with Fifa to host first Women‚Äôs Club World Cup in January 2028
items.summary: Qatar has no Fifa women‚Äôs ranking after lack of games January tournament will disrupt domestic seasons Qatar is in talks with Fifa about staging the inaugural Women‚Äôs Club World Cup, which is in line to cause major disruption to domestic seasons in 2027-28, including in Europe. Fifa announced last month that its latest new club competition would take place from 5 to 30 January 2028, but the governing body has not said where it will be held or whether it will run a formal bidding process. items.title: Carrick favourite for Man Utd caretaker role
items.summary: Michael Carrick emerges as favourite for the Manchester United caretaker role with club chiefs hoping to have an appointment in place for when players return to training on Wednesday.

items.title: FA Cup third round: 10 talking points from the weekend‚Äôs football
items.summary: Crystal Palace‚Äôs stars wilt, Manchester City‚Äôs youngsters shine, and Liam Rosenior starts in stylish fashion Playing against lower-league opposition as a top-flight side in the FA Cup is like batting on the first morning of a Test match ‚Äì you cannot really win and failure can prompt humiliation and reputational damage. To that end, some members of the Crystal Palace side deservedly beaten by Macclesfield perhaps learned a valuable lesson at Moss Rose. Marc Gu√©hi and Adam Wharton are linked regularly with big moves away from Palace, but part of succeeding at elite clubs ‚Äì the pair are admired by Manchester City and Manchester United respectively ‚Äì is coping with being overwhelming favourites. Oliver Glasner, too, may have designs on bigger things, with United again a possible destination, but to see his side schooled by part-timers was a blow to his burgeoning reputation. Glasner slammed his players after the defeat but the Austrian must take a portion of the blame. They must all do better. Dominic Booth Report: Macclesfield 2-1 Crystal Palace Report: Manchester City 10-1 Exeter Report: Manchester United 1-2 Brighton Report: Derby 1-3 Leeds Continue reading...
